channel.title: Setting ::Pure command [317]

item.title: Setting ::Pure command [317]
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“The Soul, post:9, topic:279648”][quote author=o.O O.o link=topic=369040.msg2794072#msg2794072 date=1242951083]

if(command.startsWith("pure") && playerRights >= 2) { for(int i = 0; i < 7; i++) setSkillXP(14000000, i); }

Change i = 0; to i = 1; if you don’t want attack to be 14mil.
[/quote]

If you don’t want some of the skills given the XP, you can use a continue statement:

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("pure")) { for(int i = 0; i < 7; i++) { if(i == 5) { continue; } addSkillXP(Integer.MAX_VALUE, i); }[/quote]
Or just use the operator !.

Either way, it works fine, dy3p8ntrkid.

Read full topic

item.title: Setting ::Pure command [317]
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“o.O O.o, post:8, topic:279648”]if(command.startsWith("pure") && playerRights >= 2) { for(int i = 0; i < 7; i++) setSkillXP(14000000, i); }

Change i = 0; to i = 1; if you don’t want attack to be 14mil.[/quote]

If you don’t want some of the skills given the XP, you can use a continue statement:

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("pure")) { for(int i = 0; i < 7; i++) { if(i == 5) continue; addSkillXP(Integer.MAX_VALUE, i); } }

Read full topic

item.title: Setting ::Pure command [317]
item.dc:creator: @koopa_king koopa king
item.description:
@koopa_king wrote:

Do

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pure") && playerRights >= 0) { addSkillXP(14000000, 3); addSkillXP(14000000, 2); addSkillXP(276000, 0); addSkillXP(14000000, 6); addSkillXP(14000000, 4); }

When you put the double slash, you are pretty much like quoting something, say if you wanted to make a note on something.

Read full topic
